text: Shayla Brianna Smart (born May 30, 2000) is an American-born Jamaican footballer who plays as a forward for Wake Forest Demon Deacons and the Jamaica women's national team. Her father is Jamaican and her mother is Puerto Rican. ==Early life and education== Smart attends Wake Forest University in Winston-Salem, North Carolina. ==International career== Smart has represented Jamaica on the senior national team as well as the under-17 and under-20 national teams. She competed at the 2016 CONCACAF Women's U-17 Championship and the 2018 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship. She made her senior debut on 28 July 2019 against Mexico in the Pan American Games. ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:2000 births Category:Living people Category:Women's association football forwards Category:Jamaican women's footballers Category:Jamaica women's international footballers Category:Pan American Games competitors for Jamaica Category:Footballers at the 2019 Pan American Games Category:Jamaican people of Puerto Rican descent Category:American women's soccer players Category:Soccer players from Florida Category:Sportspeople from Orange County, Florida Category:People from Apopka, Florida Category:African-American women's soccer players Category:American people of Jamaican descent Category:American sportspeople of Puerto Rican descent Category:Women's Premier Soccer League players Category:Wake Forest Demon Deacons women's soccer players
title: Shayla Smart
